p: More than two-thirds (68.8 %) of respondents answered they were willing to adjust their current work habits to adapt to the impact of extreme heat (Table 1). As to the reasons the remaining 31.2 % did not consider the adjustment of work habits during hot weather (Question 24, Additional file 1), one-third (33.3 %) thought “Enough has been done already”, followed by “I don’t think I am at risk” (30.3 %), and “I don’t think it is a serious problem” (24.4 %). Multiple logistic regression analyses indicated that workers with previous heat illness experience (OR = 1.45, 95 % CI 1.15-1.84) showed stronger willingness to adjust their heat-related work habits.
